description: First prime starting a chain of exactly n consecutive primes congruent to 1 modulo 6.
comments: The term "exactly" means that before the first and after the last primes of chain, the immediate primes are not congruent to 1 modulo 6.
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..35 (terms < 4*10^14)
A. Granville and G. Martin, Prime number races, Amer. Math. Monthly, 113 (No. 1, 2006), 1-33.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 05 2000
extensions: Corrected and extended by Reiner Martin (reinermartin(AT)hotmail.com), May 19 2001
More terms from _Jens Kruse Andersen_, May 30 2006
